haha It always makes me laugh when I read about people arguing over ridiculous things. Everyone is entitled to their opinion. And we don't have to convert everyone to our way of thinking. I mean come on! Calling someone a mother f@#$er just because they want a different movie format?! hahahaha 

Look. I think the MKV format is AWESOME because of how it can be compressed so small with great quality and the multi-audio and multi-subs can be all in one. But it is a bit more uncommon and it's new to most people. A computer won't just play it through iTunes/QuickTime or Windows Media Player automatically. MPEG-4 is AWESOME as well because so many devices can recognize the format and the Apple TV is becoming a big hit so it's nice to have movies with the .mp4 extension for the Apple TV. Everyone will have their favorites. For me personally, I want anything not in divx or .avi extension. haha But there are also those who prefer divx. It's all good. I'm just grateful for those who rip, convert and compress. I'll take it however I can get it! haha

I use the WD TV Live Plus so I don't have to actually worry about file formats, but I may be getting an Apple TV and I have family members with Apple TVs so I try to get .mp4 when I can.

I am downloading this now. I plan to comment on quality once downloaded. Thank you aoloffline for the upload!

agent1su - I can't play .mkv on my awesome PS3, so I agree that mp4 is best. I can convert the .mkv, but it is so time consuming. MP4 is a very popular format and is compatible with most technical devices. 
I wish secretmyth were here...

dallanlee - As far as quality goes, there is not much difference between .mkv and .mp4. If you convert .mkv to .mp4 with 100% quality, the file size will be close to the same. Having to convert these files is frustrating, but just something we all have to live with. Personally, I wish there was only one .whatever. Then we could all live together in peace and harmony...

Anyone with a PS3 can simply watch any MKV file by running the file through MKV2VOB first.  Its a quick process 1 minute for most movies and then you can watch the movie on your ps3 streaming from your computer with TVersity.

Hey guys. To my understanding, MKV is not a video format, but something rather like a casing, which can contain different formats of video, audio, sub and chapter file, including mp4 and rmvb. Other such "casings" include AVI and m2ts, but MKV seems to be the outstanding one.

Hey guys. To my understanding, MKV is not a video format, but something rather like a casing, which can contain different formats of video, audio, sub and chapter file, including mp4 and rmvb. Other such "casings" include AVI and m2ts, but MKV seems to be the outstanding one.

And by the way, 720 is just the maximum number of horizontal lines.
